metadata.topic: Detecting whether PC has Acrobat or Reader
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Detecting whether PC has Acrobat or Reader
metadata.email_text_original:
Just an FYI 
That article has a link to download Acrobat Reader.Using that link provides the
stub installer. 
For the non-stub, full installer version of Acrobat Reader one may prefer to use
this link instead. 
<https://get.adobe.com/reader/enterprise/
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fget.adobe.com%2Freader%2Fenterprise%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C61f5237c9b3348abf09008dbf1fbf7e2%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638369836728492873%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2BqqABnfQKhP2XdcPvVg5Xkiu4KvvnkBmb1LzqjO%2BQ2M%3D&reserved=0]> 
Note: 
-  The Enterprise name in the above site only applies to the name of download
web site, i.e. not an Enterprise version for downloading. 
- To download the full version, select the required fields – OS, Language and
Version. 
e.g. For the latest DC Continuous version, the respective/selected fields would
be: 
Windows 11   (or Windows 10 if applicable) 
English 
Reader 2023.006.20380 English for Windows 
The DC Reader downloaded file size for the Adobe Reader full installer DC
Continuous English version is: 
271,482 KB or 265 MB 
Digital signature is Nov. 4th 2023. 
…w 
From: 'David Svirskis' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: November 29, 2023 3:30 PM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Detecting whether PC has Acrobat or Reader 
Steve, the original question has an official answer, published here -
https://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/about-acrobat-reader-dc-migration-to-64-bit.html
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhelpx.adobe.com%2Facrobat%2Fkb%2Fabout-acrobat-reader-dc-migration-to-64-bit.html&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C61f5237c9b3348abf09008dbf1fbf7e2%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638369836728492873%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=xJI2Oh8bkE7yF%2BO%2F9uO%2FhA1Jtt39%2BcwKKy6cMsqa9lc%3D&reserved=0] 
In any case – not sure a new PS function is required for listing add/remove
programs, Get-Package is built in and provides heaps of details. 
Cheers, 
David
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/BYAPR05MB65529140F8F86BC1CF500A749E82A%40BYAPR05MB6552.namprd05.prod.outlook.com
